notes.text:
Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security 4.1.6. The updated images includes security fixes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of
Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text: This release of RHACS 4.1 fixes PostgreSQL vulnerabilities in the central, central-db, and scanner-db containers.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Function Call With Incorrect Argument Type

notes.text: A memory disclosure vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL that allows remote users to access sensitive information by exploiting certain aggregate function calls with 'unknown'-type arguments. Handling 'unknown'-type values from string literals without type designation can disclose bytes, potentially revealing notable and confidential information. This issue exists due to excessive data output in aggregate function calls, enabling remote users to read some portion of system memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: postgresql: Memory disclosure in aggregate function calls
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.1, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.1.6.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: postgresql: Memory disclosure in aggregate function calls

notes.text: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL that allows authenticated database users to execute arbitrary code through missing overflow checks during SQL array value modification. This issue exists due to an integer overflow during array modification where a remote user can trigger the overflow by providing specially crafted data. This enables the execution of arbitrary code on the target system, allowing users to write arbitrary bytes to memory and extensively read the server's memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: postgresql: Buffer overrun from integer overflow in array modification
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.1, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.1.6.
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update the affected package as soon as possible.

vulnerabilities.title: postgresql: Buffer overrun from integer overflow in array modification

notes.text: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL involving the pg_cancel_backend role that signals background workers, including the logical replication launcher, autovacuum workers, and the autovacuum launcher. Successful exploitation requires a non-core extension with a less-resilient background worker and would affect that specific background worker only. This issue may allow a remote high privileged user to launch a denial of service (DoS) attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: postgresql: Role pg_signal_backend can signal certain superuser processes.
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.1, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.1.6.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: postgresql: Role pg_signal_backend can signal certain superuser processes.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside a quoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator has installed files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, an attacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap superuser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: postgresql: extension script @substitutions@ within quoting allow SQL injection
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Bundled extensions are not vulnerable. Also, PostgreSQL will block this attack in the core server, so there's no need to modify individual extensions.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.1, you are advised to upgrade to patch release 4.1.6.
